snippet.textDisplay: Still sticking with you guys.  DBZA is how I found you guys, but I've loved a lot of the content you've made. I hope some day in the future the option is open to return to the project, but totally understand and respect your groups decision to to leave it at the Cell Saga.  Thank you guys for the open and heartfelt video explaining the situation and for the years of entertainment so far, and still to come!
snippet.textOriginal: Still sticking with you guys.  DBZA is how I found you guys, but I've loved a lot of the content you've made. I hope some day in the future the option is open to return to the project, but totally understand and respect your groups decision to to leave it at the Cell Saga.  Thank you guys for the open and heartfelt video explaining the situation and for the years of entertainment so far, and still to come!

snippet.textDisplay: I'm glad we all were able to experience DBZA together, it was truly an amazing series. snippet.textDisplay:
thank you, kiazer lani, although many people ( myself included ) would see something go on forever. But deep down you do long for the days before things got stale. shows, music, games you get that adrenaline and desire to see them go on forever. But eventually the thing that made them special either changes to the point were it no longer resembles what you fell in love with or the thing rots over time and the spirit of what made it special dies, am I sad this journey is over yes. But i am glad you have made the decision you have on ending the series on probably the highest note you could ( if i recall the cell saga was supposed to be the planned ending for actual dbz if Tori had got his way anyway ). I have seen so many youtube series made by creators just get dropped after schdule problems, burnout, or just loss of intrest. Just for them to be left with cliff hanger ending or to be just be teased to return. so I am glad you ended it here instead of pushing out sub-par episodes that just don't have the soul the rest of the series has had up until now, and who knows come 2025 or hell 2030 maybe you guys might get inspired and make the buu saga {not emplying anything just saying 10 years is a long time, it could still happen <)}. I'm not calling this an end of an era just a journey lets see were the next one takes us, I hope to see you all there.


- Thank you Team Four Star for inspiring us all.

Just for them to be left with cliff hanger ending or to be just be teased to return. so I am glad you ended it here instead of pushing out sub-par episodes that just don't have the soul the rest of the series has had up until now,  and who knows come 2025 or hell 2030 maybe you guys might get inspired and make the buu saga {not emplying anything just saying 10 years is a long time, it could still happen <)}. I'm not calling this an end of an era just a journey lets see were the next one takes us, I hope to see you all there.

snippet.textDisplay:
When I first started watching DBZA back in high school, I knew nothing about Dragon Ball but that didn't matter. I loved your writing, comedy, and passion. Even as a non-DBZ fan, it was so clear that you all respected the source material and cared about persevering the integrity of the story and characters.

Watching more of your content over the years, I got to know all of you at TFS as individuals and be part of a community. It was because of your Bloodborne streams that I'm now a huge fan of From Software games. Now I'm finishing my Ph.D. and I just want to say thank you for all the amazing memories.

Yes, it's sad to see DBZA end. But because of DBZA, I found something even better: TeamFourStar. Whatever's best for you guys as individuals and creators, I'm behind it 100%. I can't wait to see what's next and I wish each of you the best!
snippet.textOriginal:
When I first started watching DBZA back in high school, I knew nothing about Dragon Ball but that didn't matter. I loved your writing, comedy, and passion. Even as a non-DBZ fan, it was so clear that you all respected the source material and cared about persevering the integrity of the story and characters. 

Watching more of your content over the years, I got to know all of you at TFS as individuals and be part of a community. It was because of your Bloodborne streams that I'm now a huge fan of From Software games. Now I'm finishing my Ph.D. and I just want to say thank you for all the amazing memories. 

Yes, it's sad to see DBZA end. But because of DBZA, I found something even better: TeamFourStar. Whatever's best for you guys as individuals and creators, I'm behind it 100%. I can't wait to see what's next and I wish each of you the best!

snippet.textDisplay: You guys are amazing! You've been letting us all relive the things we love for years, you guys deserve a break to work on new and different things. Good luck on your next venture!
snippet.textOriginal: You guys are amazing! You've been letting us all relive the things we love for years, you guys deserve a break to work on new and different things. Good luck on your next venture!

snippet.textDisplay: I just want to thank you guys so much for creating something that has made me so happy. Literally I watch DBZA frequently because it’s like a stress reliever for me. Creating content that has that sort of affect on people is a gift. So thankful we got to experience that gift for as long as we did.

snippet.textDisplay: Thank you guys for your honesty and all the hard work that you have done in the production DBZA. Much respect and I look forward to the OC you guys come up with!

snippet.textDisplay: Well, you just signed the end of your fame/popularity sadly. Why do I say this? Because DBZA was, and will always be, the most popular content on your channel. More so than Hellsing Abridged. It was what drew fans to you, it was why they donated to your patreon. And you just spat in their faces. Every contribution made to you guys in hopes of seeing future eps of DBZA, you just basically stole that money. So, I won't wish you good luck. Instead, I wish you rethink on your commitments to both yourself and your audience. If you wanna make new content, great! But don't abandon the thing your fans love most for some petty, bullshit excuses.
snippet.textOriginal: Well, you just signed the end of your fame/popularity sadly. Why do I say this? Because DBZA was, and will always be, the most popular content on your channel. snippet.textDisplay:
I, like many others, am not happy that it's coming to an end so long after the season 3 finale. DBZA has been the one constant in my life since I first came across it 12 years ago.


THAT BEING SAID, I don't understand how some people can watch this video and still be so angry and hateful of these guys for making the decision. Burn out is something that happens to everyone and there's not much you can do about. Just hearing the pain in their voices and seeing them hold back tears while they make this announcement broke my heart. This obviously wasn't an easy decision and they don't deserve the hate that they've been getting.
snippet.textOriginal:
I, like many others, am not happy that it's coming to an end so long after the season 3 finale. DBZA has been the one constant in my life since I first came across it 12 years ago.


THAT BEING SAID, I don't understand how some people can watch this video and still be so angry and hateful of these guys for making the decision. Burn out is something that happens to everyone and there's not much you can do about. Just hearing the pain in their voices and seeing them hold back tears while they make this announcement broke my heart. This obviously wasn't an easy decision and they don't deserve the hate that they've been getting.

snippet.textDisplay:
I am sorry to here this, but I hope in 5 maybe 10 years you could come back to it and have another crack at it. If I am still around I'll watch it for sure.

DBA:A E61 2030 Confirmed?

:p

OOO ooo ooo I know Attack on Titan Abridged episode 2

Made in Abyss Abridged, The Promised Neverland, Hunter x Hunter, Code Geass,  Vinland Saga... I would say Gurran Lagann but it would be a bit hard to make a parody of as it's not serious in the first place...Psycho-Pass? I think that would be pretty simple to parody, Black Lagoon I think would be a pretty interesting parody to make and it's short too, at most you could get like 12 - 16 abridged episodes out of it.

Shield Hero maybe.

But in all seriousness, you guys are owed big by Funi, those turnds, Toei, and many others who were responsible for Dragonball.


You guys made it relevent again, or at least for me, cuz I didn't give two shits about Dragon Ball Z for a while and I honestly thought you guys would do that first episode and never come back, but you did, and you all came back strong and I thank you for giving me this free entertainment that was honestly worth much more than that.

snippet.textDisplay:
Came for DBZA, stayed for TFS Gaming. Nuzlocke rules apply, the dead shall not be missed!

Thank you for having the self-awareness to know it was time to stop. Seasons 1-3 are still and will always be one of my favorite series ever. Looking forward to what you guys come up with in the future!
snippet.textOriginal:
Came for DBZA, stayed for TFS Gaming.  Nuzlocke rules apply, the dead shall not be missed!

Thank you for having the self-awareness to know it was time to stop.  Seasons 1-3 are still and will always be one of my favorite series ever.  Looking forward to what you guys come up with in the future!

snippet.textDisplay:
I've loved watching DBZA for so long, and while I can't say I watch really any of your other content, it has been one of my favorite series of all time. I support your decision in every way, as the Buu arc is my favorite DBZ story, and while I was incredibly excited to see what you'd do with it, I'd much rather you not tarnish your own name and give the arc the respect it deserves.

All that said, as a writer who has struggled with this very issue in the past, I think it's disingenuous to the series and to your brand to say it's completely done. I've had my own series in the works for around a decade, and I've barely actually written any of it down. I've thought up stories, dropped them and thought up different stories, forgot what stories I made but came up with better ones, etc. My suggestion to you as group, would be to forget what all the haters say, and maybe have a "Season 4" file or room or whatever, that over time people just throw ideas into. If it never happens, then it never happens. But who's to say one of you will never wake up one day and say "You know what? This would work really well!!" Personally, the interactions of your version of Vegeta being Majin-fied would be enough for me to get the ball rolling.

In the end, I don't think you should force it. I think it could be the best version of this series of all time, and that requires an immense amount of time to get right, and I know you're the guys to do it :)

All that said, as a writer who has struggled with this very issue in the past, I think it's disingenuous to the series and to your brand to say it's completely done. I've had my own series in the works for around a decade, and I've barely actually written any of it down. In the end, I don't think you should force it. I think it could be the best version of this series of all time, and that requires an immense amount of time to get right, and I know you're the guys to do it :)

snippet.textDisplay:
Eh, I would be upset but... I've seen way to many shows go on longer than they should have. There are a graveyards filled with things that should have ended a long time ago. Supernatural, Star Wars, Bleach, World of Warcraft, and God knows how many others. It's better to end on a high note with people wanting more, than people growing bored and wishing you'd just stop.

This is probably for the best.

I guess I'm just sad that you guys probably won't abridge anything else. Like, the Final Fantasy things is cool buuuut... Things are just funnier when they're done with the original footage. You guys were REALLY good at that despite it causing you issues. Maybe you can see if some companies would be up for a professionally abridged show? Kind of like Ghost Stories. Could be like, a whole new industry in anime.

Anyway, I'm gonna be honest... Not really into your other content. It's nothing personal, I've just been watching DBZA since it started and your other stuff (aside from Hellsing and Attack on Titan) just hasn't grabbed me. I do wish you guys all the best. You've provided me with years of entertainment and things I'll quote until I'm senile and in an old folks home.

snippet.textDisplay: Ok then.
snippet.textOriginal: Ok then.

snippet.textDisplay:
I started keeping up with DBZA around episode 18, and I loved it. You guys made this content for free and it was an incredible show. Back then, episodes were coming out consistently, and were unfailingly hilarious. Soon, you started a Patreon, and claimed that you wanted to do more with not only DBZA, but other projects that didn't rely on copyrighted content. Patrons have been donating money to you every since, and you made it clear up front that while a patreon donation would not speed up production of DBZA, that DBZA would not fall by the wayside and you wouldn't forget the fans and the show to whom you owe any success you have in other areas. Despite now getting money from Patreon, DBZA episodes began to become more and more delayed. Your website advertised "roughly" 1 episode per month, but in almost all cases 6 months or more (being generous) would go by between releases. All the while, more and more content for things like gaming and other marketing opportunities were being released more and more frequently. Rather than DBZA episodes, we got a lot of "update" videos trying to explain the delays with DBZA- and whatever the reasons that's fair, after all it was free content (even though you were receiving money from fans of DBZA). Nevertheless, it became harder and harder for me to believe you weren't letting DBZA fall by the wayside, and it became harder and harder to see these "update" videos as anything more than excuses from people who would honestly rather be making more money on something other than an abridged series. The delay between episodes, despite all the patreon funds and growing fanbase, only got worse as time went on. And then, after going out of your way to change your original plan to end after the cell saga, you told your fanbase you were going to do the buu saga, and people gave you money again for this. Now, after keeping up with you guys for all these years, it seems like you're just executing the stage of your plan that started when you started your patreon and gaming content: to phase out DBZA. It's your art, and it is absolutely your right to end it, but I think you've been shitty to your fans, I'm thankful I didn't donate money to your patreon, and I feel sorry for anyone who did- especially anyone who donated after you announced the buu saga.


Thank you so much for all the laughs and fun memories. You're amazing artists and I hope that whatever you decide to do going forward, you are honest and up-front about it both with yourselves and your fans.
snippet.textOriginal:

Back then, episodes were coming out consistently, and were unfailingly hilarious. Soon, you started a Patreon, and claimed that you wanted to do more with not only DBZA, but other projects that didn't rely on copyrighted content. Patrons have been donating money to you every since, and you made it clear up front that while a patreon donation would not speed up production of DBZA, that DBZA would not fall by the wayside and you wouldn't forget the fans and the show to whom you owe any success you have in other areas. Despite now getting money from Patreon, DBZA episodes began to become more and more delayed. Your website advertised "roughly" 1 episode per month, but in almost all cases 6 months or more (being generous) would go by between releases. All the while, more and more content for things like gaming and other marketing opportunities were being released more and more frequently. Rather than DBZA episodes, we got a lot of  "update" videos trying to explain the delays with DBZA- and whatever the reasons that's fair, after all it was free content (even though you were receiving money from fans of DBZA). Nevertheless, it became harder and harder for me to believe you weren't letting DBZA fall by the wayside, and it became harder and harder to see these "update" videos as anything more than excuses from people who would honestly rather be making more money on something other than an abridged series. The delay between episodes, despite all the patreon funds and growing fanbase, only got worse as time went on. And then, after going out of your way to change your original plan to end after the cell saga, you told your fanbase you were going to do the buu saga, and people gave you money again for this. Now, after keeping up with you guys for all these years, it seems like you're just executing the stage of your plan that started when you started your patreon and gaming content: to phase out DBZA. It's your art, and it is absolutely your right to end it, but I think you've been shitty to your fans, I'm thankful I didn't donate money to your patreon, and I feel sorry for anyone who did- especially anyone who donated after you announced the buu saga.


Thank you so much for all the laughs and fun memories. You're amazing artists and I hope that whatever you decide to do going forward, you are honest and up-front about it both with yourselves and your fans.

snippet.textDisplay: It has been a long and wild ride. Not just for Kaiser and Lani, but for the fans. You look back on all that DBZA has gone through, the changes (Remember the April fools video, the changing in disclaimer intro?) I'm surprised it's ending, but I'm not sad about it. TeamFourStar has grown beyond DBZA, and they ended it on their own terms, they didn't allow CopyRight claims to take the ending from them. That's something to respect and admire, they hang up their crowns as kings, and leave a legacy to cherish. Because yeah, you think of DBZA and you remember Dragon Ball, and the people passionate enough to immortalize it forever in fans hearts everywhere.
snippet.textOriginal: It has been a long and wild ride. Not just for Kaiser and Lani, but for the fans. You look back on all that DBZA has gone through, the changes (Remember the April fools video, the changing in disclaimer intro?) I'm surprised it's ending, but I'm not sad about it. TeamFourStar has grown beyond DBZA, and they ended it on their own terms, they didn't allow CopyRight claims to take the ending from them. That's something to respect and admire, they hang up their crowns as kings, and leave a legacy to cherish. Because yeah, you think of DBZA and you remember Dragon Ball, and the people passionate enough to immortalize it forever in fans hearts everywhere.

snippet.textDisplay: I will always love you guys for your work over the last decade and change. DBZ abridged has honestly been half my life and while I have changed and changed and changed again my love for the show and the quality of the humor never faded. Each of you came together from different projects and background and defined a generation. No, BUILT A GENRE in the youtube space. I know 14 year olds that have GROWN UP with DBZ:A, watching it with their fathers, brothers, and close friends. There is no proper way to describe how you molded those kids, One of them wants to be a voice actor because of you all. You inspired him and no matter where we go from here it will only be up! My heart may be hurt, the medicine may be bitter, but this is the dawn of a new day.

I know 14 year olds that have GROWN UP with DBZ:A, watching it with their fathers, brothers, and close friends. There is no proper way to describe how you molded those kids, One of them wants to be a voice actor because of you all. You inspired him and no matter where we go from here it will only be up! My heart may be hurt, the medicine may be bitter, but this is the dawn of a new day.

snippet.textDisplay: My Subscription is Over, Here's Why
snippet.textOriginal: My Subscription is Over, Here's Why

snippet.textDisplay: I've watched since episode one and I've watched the whole series and each of the movies countless times. Literally my favourite thing on this site. I am absolutely gutted. But, the most important thing in life is to do what makes you happy rather than force yourself into making others happy. As a long term fan, I completely understand where you are coming from. Thank you for the commitment, hard work and the often side-splitting laughter. I definitely think you ended it at the perfect time, I'm looking forward to what happens next. TEAM THREE STAR!!
snippet.textOriginal: I've watched since episode one and I've watched the whole series and each of the movies countless times. Literally my favourite thing on this site. I am absolutely gutted. But, the most important thing in life is to do what makes you happy rather than force yourself into making others happy. As a long term fan, I completely understand where you are coming from. Thank you for the commitment, hard work and the often side-splitting laughter. I definitely think you ended it at the perfect time, I'm looking forward to what happens next. TEAM THREE STAR!!

snippet.textDisplay: Here's some advice... Your doing the right thing. Do get me wrong, I like DBZA. Cell was the best. But, you just got to know when to call it quits. Don't be like the Nostalgia Critic, saying your done, then come back. I like the critic but his reviews have become bland, repetive, and uninspiring. He should have stopped when he did. You TFS can still do other projects, and make awesome vids. Its best to end DBZA on a high note, rather than keep going and become boring like the NC. Trust  me, you guys are great...
snippet.textOriginal: Here's some advice... Your doing the right thing. Do get me wrong, I like DBZA. Cell was the best. But, you just got to know when to call it quits. Don't be like the Nostalgia Critic, saying your done, then come back. I like the critic but his reviews have become bland, repetive, and uninspiring. He should have stopped when he did. You TFS can still do other projects, and make awesome vids. Its best to end DBZA on a high note, rather than keep going and become boring like the NC. Trust  me, you guys are great...

snippet.textDisplay: @TeamFourStar Thank you guys for so many years of great content from the beginning, and even more so of what's to come. You guys are awesome and I personally can guarantee that you have made so many people happy and helped this amazing community by making so many dark days so much more positive for many individuals whom watch your content, through your humor. Creative burnout happens to everyone we understand wholeheartedly and will support you guys and all of your amazing content keep up the amazing work and keep being awesome and most importantly follow your dreams and have fun!!! Best of luck to you guys and all of your future endeavors, cannot wait to see what you guys come up with next!!!
